concept.title: Automatic Profile Variables
concept.shortdesc: For each visitor, 1:1 automatically stores many variables to be used by the modeling system.

conbody.p: No setup is required for automatic profile variables to be collected. They include:

Also, if third party data targeting is included in the contract, variables for geo-targeting and demographic providers are automatically added. Finally, a visitor's activity on the site is captured, including:

Interest areas determine what content or site sections visitors are most interested in. This information is often very predictive in determining what content is best to show. Site URLs are mapped to higher-level categories, or "interest areas" (for example, mapping men's product page viewing to a "men's" interest area), without need for manual updates or monitoring. Test&Target 1:1 automatically crawls client sites based on the domains that send mbox calls to Test&Target and groups URLs based on the site's structure, as defined by the site's site map or general URL structure. Very common pages, like the home page, are removed from the interest area groupings.

Interest areas are stored in the training data and, if they are predictive, affect the model and display in the insights report. This is all done automatically. No manual edits or updates to interest areas are needed.
